Class GameModel.Character1

java.lang.Object
GameModel.Character1
Enclosing class:
GameModel
public class GameModel.Character1
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the character object and stores set values and values to change. Contains methods for the character object to move, spawn, die, much more.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Character1​(int intID, double dblX, double dblY, int intHP, int intAttack, double dblSpeedX, double dblSpeedY, int intCharType, java.lang.String strUser)
    This is the constructor with parameters, respectively, of the player ID, the player's coordinates, the player's HP, the player's speed in X and Y, the character they selected, and their username.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void collision​(int intIDn, int intDamagen)
    This method detects collision for the character object.
    boolean deathCheck()
    This method checks if the player has died.
    void down​(int dblSpeedYIn)
    This method calculates the speed at which the character moves downwards in the Y axis.
    void left​(int dblSpeedXIn)
    This method calculates the speed at which the character moves in the X axis.
    void moveX()
    The moveX method is the basic movement of the character object in the X axis.
    void moveY()
    The moveY method is the basic movement of the character object in the Y axis.
    boolean outCheck()
    This method checks if the player has less than one Life.
    void right​(int dblSpeedXIn)
    This method calculates the speed at which the character moves left in the X axis.
    void shoot​(int intIDn, double dblSpeedXn, double dblSpeedYn, int intSize, double dblXFrom, double dblYFrom)
    This method shoots a projectile by creating a new projectile in the projectile tracker array, and is based on Player ID, Projectile Speed in X and Y components, and the maximum range of the projectile.
    boolean skill​(int intIDn, int intCharTypeIn, double dblSpeedY, double dblYn)
    Dependent on the Character Type, this method will use that certain Character's skill.
    void spawn()
    The spawn method determines where the player spawns and is dependent on the Player ID, which is given to them once they join.
    void up​(int dblSpeedYIn)
    This method calculates the speed at which the character moves upwards in the Y axis.
    void update()
    This method updates the projectile range, skill cooldowns, and runs with the timer.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Character1

      public Character1​(int intID, double dblX, double dblY, int intHP, int intAttack, double dblSpeedX, double dblSpeedY, int intCharType, java.lang.String strUser)
      This is the constructor with parameters, respectively, of the player ID, the player's coordinates, the player's HP, the player's speed in X and Y, the character they selected, and their username.

  • Method Details

    • spawn

      public void spawn()
      The spawn method determines where the player spawns and is dependent on the Player ID, which is given to them once they join.

    • moveX

      public void moveX()
      The moveX method is the basic movement of the character object in the X axis. This method also limits character borders.

    • moveY

      public void moveY()
      The moveY method is the basic movement of the character object in the Y axis. This method also limits character borders.

    • up

      public void up​(int dblSpeedYIn)
      This method calculates the speed at which the character moves upwards in the Y axis. Determined and modified by User Input.

    • down

      public void down​(int dblSpeedYIn)
      This method calculates the speed at which the character moves downwards in the Y axis. Determined and modified by User Input.

    • right

      public void right​(int dblSpeedXIn)
      This method calculates the speed at which the character moves left in the X axis. Determined and modified by User Input.

    • left

      public void left​(int dblSpeedXIn)
      This method calculates the speed at which the character moves in the X axis. Determined and modified by User Input.

    • shoot

      public void shoot​(int intIDn, double dblSpeedXn, double dblSpeedYn, int intSize, double dblXFrom, double dblYFrom)
      This method shoots a projectile by creating a new projectile in the projectile tracker array, and is based on Player ID, Projectile Speed in X and Y components, and the maximum range of the projectile.

    • skill

      public boolean skill​(int intIDn, int intCharTypeIn, double dblSpeedY, double dblYn)
      Dependent on the Character Type, this method will use that certain Character's skill. This method will only return true if the Skill Bar is full. Otherwise, it will return false.

    • collision

      public void collision​(int intIDn, int intDamagen)
      This method detects collision for the character object. Each collision has Hidden IDs, and if a certain terrain object has a certain ID, the character will either not be able to walk into the terrain or they will take damage from it (I.e water).

    • update

      public void update()
      This method updates the projectile range, skill cooldowns, and runs with the timer.

    • deathCheck

      public boolean deathCheck()
      This method checks if the player has died. The lives will slowly go done.

    • outCheck

      public boolean outCheck()
      This method checks if the player has less than one Life. If they have less than one life, they are "out" or eliminated from the game.
